meanings.definition: A person who has received a license, especially to practice a profession.
meanings.sent1: The licentiate proudly displayed their license on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The licentiate was authorized to work as a professional in their field.
meanings.sent3: The licentiate joked that their license was their ticket to success.
meanings.sent4: Becoming a licentiate was like unlocking a door to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The licentiate's license gleamed in the sunlight, symbolizing their achievement.

meanings.sent1: The authority decided to licentiate the new business for operation.
meanings.sent2: They will licentiate the drivers after they pass the required tests.
meanings.sent3: The city council will licentiate the street performers to ensure safety.
meanings.sent4: The government must licentiate all food vendors to maintain standards.
meanings.sent5: The board will licentiate the professionals to regulate their practice.
